definition: abbr. for 論語|论语[Lun2 yu3], The Analects (of Confucius)
opinion/view/theory/doctrine/to discuss/to talk about/to regard/to consider/per/by the (kilometer, hour etc)
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: The issue of the conflict isn't as black and white from the lens of the priest in the temple.
sentences.chinese: 庙方祭师认为，冲突不能用非黑即白两分法论断。

sentences.english: This article analyses the scientific nature of this thesis on point of legal view.
sentences.chinese: 本文试从法律角度分析这一论断的科学性。

sentences.english: Keep him in that state of mind as long as you can.
sentences.chinese: 尽量让他保持骄傲，论断，不悔改的状态，越久越好。

sentences.english: But part of Greer's argument was that men were the last people who could make such judgments.
sentences.chinese: 格里尔的一部分论断是，男人是最终做决定的人们。

sentences.english: This has been confirmed in scientific management.
sentences.chinese: 这一论断在科学管理中得到了确证。

sentences.english: This is, of course, a counterintuitive argument.
sentences.chinese: 这是一个让所有人感到违心的论断。

sentences.english: Any assertion to the contrary is simply not true.
sentences.chinese: 而任何相反的论断都是完全不真实的。

sentences.english: The 17th CPC National Congress made new thesis that let powers running in the sunshine.
sentences.chinese: “让权力在阳光下运行”是党的十七大提出的新论断。

sentences.english: Huntington's arguments were always made with great force, erudition, and persuasiveness.
sentences.chinese: 亨廷顿的论断总是很给力，博学多闻，具有说服力。

sentences.english: The presentation is of great significance to theory and reality.
sentences.chinese: 这个科学论断的提出具有重大的理论意义和现实意义。

sentences.english: Colton, a great writer once remarked. But it still has a profound significance now.
sentences.chinese: 他的这个精辟的论断至今仍有深远的意义。

sentences.english: He had to endure snide remarks by the Furious Five.
sentences.chinese: 他也必须容忍无畏武侠的论断。

sentences.english: This statement can be broadened to include the whole area of economic decision-making.
sentences.chinese: 这一论断可以推广到包括经济决策在内的整个领域。

sentences.english: For all these reasons, Hobbes concludes, a monarchy is best.
sentences.chinese: 霍布士论断，因为所有这些理由，君主制最完善。

sentences.english: The indirect apodosis is often a speech act without a speech-act prefix.
sentences.chinese: 间接论断句经常是省略了言语举动前缀的言语举动。

sentences.english: The soon-to-be-published 3-year follow-up data confirm this.
sentences.chinese: 即将发表的3年随访数值也证实了这一论断。

definition: conclusion/verdict/CL:個|个[ge4]/to conclude/to reach a verdict
wording (of a proposal)/formulation/viewpoint (on an issue)/(one of eight methods of bonesetting in TCM) restoring the part displaced by a fracture to its correct position by lifting
to prove a point/to expound on/to demonstrate or prove (through argument)/proof
to jump to an unfounded conclusion
